extendedInfo.description: Application for simple Bluetooth file sharing using NFC. Run this application from the context menu of a selected file and tap phones to start the file transfer.Application does automatically, without requiring user interaction: * enable Bluetooth * establish a connection with the second device * disable Bluetooth after file transfer to save a batteryNOTE: Only for devices with NFC support, tested on Nexus S. The application has to be installed on both devices.TO-DO: With new Adroid 4.0 SDK: Automatic installation of this app on the second device, screen switching right after NFC tag is transmitted.

reviews.title: Very nice concept but error in G Nexus
reviews.comment: Same as another reviewer, error near the end of transfer. Why? Note: I tested it using a Gnexus 4.0.4 with a Nexus S 4.0.4, same error at both directions.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nice idea, doesn\'t work for me or my family
reviews.comment: I will give FITeam17 credit for how this is supposed to work.  I like the idea of becoming an item in the Share menu.  From there, the use is very easy (in theory).  However, I have tried to share files (pictures, mostly, but other items, too), with 4 different people who all have the exact same model of phone.  Every single time, the two phones vibrate in recognition of the attempted connection, and even look like they\'re starting the \"handshake\".  Yet, in the end, the file transfer never starts...never....let alone completes.  I\'ve written to the developer with zero response.  HTC EVO 4G LTE, on both Ice Cream Sandwich, and later Jelly Bean.  Stock OS as delivered by Sprint.  Checked, double, even quintuple checked BlueTooth settings in both phones, and can\'t find any reason why the transfer doesn\'t go.  I work with technology for a living and think I\'m a pretty technically savvy person.  And, yet, I can\'t get it to work.  So, nice intentions, but no go on execution, at least for me.
reviews.author: Andrew Cook

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: It\'s what I\'ve been looking for for quite some time. There are some quirks like having to toggle Bluetooth every once in a while to initiate transfer but that\'s nothing compared to how crappy sending files was before this app.
reviews.author: Tyler Shivers

reviews.title: Good job.
reviews.comment: Perfect app!

reviews.title: Should have been better
reviews.comment: I can send/receive files using 2 Galaxy Nexuses but need a little tweak, I have to uncheck \"Disable Bluetooth after....\" otherwise the transfer will be error at the end. Should the turn off of bluetooth have a delay about a few seconds after the transfer, this will be better.
reviews.author: A Google User
